name: misemploy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to employ a worker in a way that is not right or useful: Why do people stay in their current situation if they are misemployed? The person is misemployed in dealing with a fictitious case.
to use something in a way that is not right or useful: This notion can produce disastrous results when it is misemployed. They employed - or rather misemployed - weapons of economic warfare. Related word
employ verb (USE) formal
More examplesFewer examplesThe majority of people are misemployed - they may be underemployed, not happy with their position, or not fairly compensated for their skills. He said that some speakers misemployed the word “thee” for “thou”, perhaps believing it to be less formal.
